alert.note: Alert for Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 16 at 4:17AM CDT until October 17 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...LAKE-EFFECT SNOW SHOWERS EXPECTED TONIGHT AND MONDAY... .A cold north flow across Lake Superior will generate periods of lake-effect snow showers tonight through Monday. The combination of snow and some blowing and drifting snow, and this being the first significant snowfall of the season will likely result in hazardous travel conditions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and some blowing and drifting snow expected. Total snow accumulations ranging from 4 to 8 inches in the snowbelt to 2 to 4 inches elsewhere. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph on Monday. * WHERE...Vilas County. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions are expected, including for the Monday morning and evening commutes * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is likely to be heavy at times tonight. The snow may not be quite as heavy on Monday, but north winds will be gusting to 35 mph by that time, and blowing and drifting snow is likely to have a substantial impact on travel during the day on Monday.
info.instruction: This being the first significant snowfall of the season, plan extra travel into any trips tonight or Monday. Be sure to slow down and use caution while traveling. Consider taking a flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
